citeinfo.title: SFP_Historical_Beach
citeinfo.othercit: This database was created by William Lettis & Associates, Inc. for the Oakland Museum of California and the San Francisco Estuary Institute (SFEI), under a grant from the State Water Resources Control Board through CNPS Pollution Control Grant agreement No. 04-139-552-0 awarded to SFEI. Supplemental funding was provided by the City of San Francisco Public Utilities Commission, and San Mateo Countywide Water Pollution Prevention Program. Copies of the database can be obtained from the San Francisco Estuary Institute, Oakland, CA.

descript.abstract: This shapefile details the historical beach environments of the San Francisco peninsula. These historical beach data were researched and published by the San Francisco Estuary Institute (SFEI) (EcoAtlas ver 1.5, 1998). We have incorporated the EcoAtlas data into this map. Please note that during the mechanical transfer of the data, minor shifts in the lines may have occurred. (See process description.) Should questions arise we direct the user to the original EcoAtlas GIS file, available from SFEI (www.sfei.org). This database was designed to help the general public and regional planners understand how water flows through San Francisco peninsula watersheds.
descript.purpose: The purpose of this shapefile is to show historical beaches that have since been covered or excavated. These digital GIS files represent the same lines as published on the Oakland Museum's Creek & watershed map series.

sngdate.caldate: The polygons in this digital database represent the most current data available at the time of data compilation. If users have concerns that these data are not up to date, they are encouraged to contact the local city government that has jurisdiction over the area in question.

idinfo.accconst: This work is public domain and we encourage the public to use the information openly and appropriately.
idinfo.useconst: These data were compiled at 1:24,000 scale and comprise a regional dataset. This dataset is not a substitute for a site-specific engineering study of surface hydrology.
idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350

citeinfo.origin: William Lettis & Associates, Inc. Author : Janet Sowers, Robert Givler, M. Teresa Ramirez-Herrera, Tillery, A., Richard, C.M., and Pearce, S.; Digital database prepared by Ranon Dulberg and Jason Holmberg.
citeinfo.title: Creek and Watershed Map of the San Francisco Peninsula: A Digital Database

horizpa.horizpar: All data should be considered approximate.

procstep.procdesc: This shapefile was created from Freehand files and imported into Arcview using a Freehand extension called Map Publisher. The shapefile was then registered to the Stateplane coordinate system using an Arcview Tool called Spatial Adjustment. These data were compiled at a scale of 1:24,000 and will be accurate at this scale. Use of the data at larger scales would be inappropriate as data may appear erroneous when enlarged.

srcinfo.srccontr: The historical beaches were compiled from the San Francisco Estuary Institute's EcoAtlas ver. 1.5, 1988, and from the U. S. Coast Survey maps dated from 1850 to 1900. A complete list of sources is provided in PeninsulaCreeksGIS_Readme_ver.1.1. Additional documentation can be obtained from Janet Sowers at William Lettis & Associates, Inc. in Walnut Creek, or at www.museumca.org/creeks/.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata
